alert.note: Alert for Kodiak Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 17 at 8:09PM AKDT until March 19 at 4:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 14 inches possible with hightes amounts toward Afognak Island. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. Visibilities possibly dropping to one quarter mile or less at times. * WHERE...Kodiak Island, from Kodiak City northward, especially Afognak Island. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A storm system very similar to the one that passed on Friday will affect the area bringing heavy snowfall and gusty winds to the area. Kodiak City may see significantly less snow than further northward and could only be in the 2-4 inch range, but could see period of low visibility as previously fallen snow blows around as well.
info.instruction: A winter storm means there is a potential for significant snow, sleet, or ice accumulations that may impact travel. People are encouraged to closely monitor this weather situation. Preparation for this potentially dangerous weather event should begin now. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
